messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1405
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/3/01 7:49:09 PM Mountain Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/3/01 7:49:09 PM Mountain Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Thanks everyone for your words of wisdom!!! I don't have any "unschooled"
support except for you all!! My "homeschool" friends get me going sometimes
about my kids future! Thanks for setting me straight! I hope you all had a
great weekend!
>>


This struck me just now b/c I was speaking w/ my mother today. What does
she mention.......cyberschool for homeschoolers and how PA. is paying for it
and maybe my state ID. will too. UGH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Why can't people
understand or at least stop bringing it up. First off my dd is 5 years old
and if I was a PSer and held her back a year they all would have nothing to
say. But b/c I homeschool everyone has an opinion. I know, learn to deal, but
it frustrates me so. Maybe I frustrate me since I am such a wimp w/ my mother
I can't argue this w/ her. I usually say she is 5 and right where she should
be according to K. Usually shuts them up. Then I may have to go on and say if
we feel the need for a ciric in the future we will seek one. Usually the
naysayers are satisfied w/ this. I can see or hear the relief.

NICKI~ who is very PMSy and late to boot. GGGGRRRRRRR it is a get
outta my way kinda day. <VBG>
